c_IR3HJarVbmSsX2LZ-YLw.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. The manager is really nice and helpful

TReDKJjJU-PPRBP-tBzUmg.text: I'm not a huge fan of sushi, but the salads are great, my favourite is the salmon marinated in miso and the duck rolls are good too. Good service, not the cheapest place around, but excellent quality food. They serve hot food in this branch, noodle souple, dumplings.

cFPUiAaAATzQnOMkXa3SOw.text: Great food and now addicted to frozen yoghurt with blueberries - can't go wrong here. I wish everything was a little cheaper but worth checking out.

LIyAEXc-3KZky22H8ArIKA.text: I have to say I've absolutely fallen in love with Itsu. The soups are so yummy and guilt free being so healthy - they totally fill you up and at £5 are pretty reasonably priced. I would recommend the one with vegetable dumplings. The fresh juices on offer are different - the detox one has a real punch of ginger and leaves you feeling energised after. Theres a good variety of different sushi combos and love the way the sushi comes with glass noodle or rocket salad and toasted pumpkin seeds too - something a bit different. I only wish I could afford to eat here every day for lunch!

ioQSlPBBbC5LpFl2lhCkhw.text: I prefer Yo! Sushi. The food at Itsu is average and prices is a bit more expensive than Yo! Sushi.

OjhX3ScT55KoZqNzB4l9XA.text: I went to Itsu for lunch and I must admit, I prefer Yo! Sushi. Prices are about the same but food quality at Yo!Sushi is better.

C2Xy3nPI5PGrz0KfbRDBiw.text: Itsu was a very good place for light lunch.I like this place from last year.The sushi and noodles in the shop were well presented and much more healthy.Especially the noodles,plus the soup,were very good indeed in cold in winter.The shop also had lots of seats too.The shop was more popular now as the queue at busy time was longer.Also more choices were introduced recently.The shop really worth a look.

NDrsN09CF68fIXSJ3PGH3w.text: nice staff nice food me and my mr love it

6VI_AXIdglQPPnQnhyp7ng.text: Walking around on our first day in London, of course we got hungry.  And to my surprise, there were quite the number of fast food chain type of Japanese/Noodles places.  We decided on Itsu because it looked clean and it was the closest thing to the London Tourist Center in Picadilly Circus.Generally, I am a bit fearful of sushi (raw fish) sitting in some cool container just waiting.  I was even a bit more fearful as I wasn't too sure of how clean London restaurants are.  But suffice it to say, I took a chance because...well...the sushi looked really good and it even came with salad.Because my mom and I were sharing the meal, we also ordered a vegetable dumpling soup, which was more than enough, even for 2 people.As mentioned, the sushi came with a salad that was quite refreshing with it's light dressing and sunflower seeds.  The sushi itself was pretty fresh, and I adored the little soy sauce containers they gave us.  Not your average foil pack like here in the States.All the soups came in 2 different sizes, except the vegetable dumpling soup.  It just came in a large.  I guess they figured if you are a vegetarian, you do need to eat more.  But the dumplings were yummy, the veggies nice and fresh, and the sunflower seeds seemed to make their way also into the soup, making it really nice.  I did find the soup a little on the salty side, but oh well.For our first meal in London, it wasn't bad at all.  And I figured, if I couldn't find anything else to eat, I'd definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Itsu - London, United Kingdom. Vegetable Dumpling Noodles, Sushi, and Rice Crackers

KEWDE4peHHxOq5dRME-PRg.text: This branch of Itsu is a few doors down from the Caviar House and I think this is making it lift its standard of decor. There are fancy banquettes, lots of dark wood and mirrors on one wall to make the place look bigger.Sashimi bento box containing generous slices of tuna and salmon with wakame salad and edmame for £9.95, a glass of watermelon, lime and iced tea from the big cooling container for £1.67 and blueberry froyo for under £2 - yummy lunch and healthy too!

IZ6UlnKQnOXdfQdivJjOIA.text: Itsu is going Down Down Down.  The soups are getting worse, the sushi is getting worse and OMG so expensive.I walked in the other day balked at the price of a box of sushi and walked to Japan center.  The extra 5 minutes walk each way means I get to eat like an extra 20 calories.  And enjoy it.Getting a sense of deja vu today that Yelp keeps deleting my reviews.  This is the second one I am sure I've reviewed but apparently I haven't.Whatever.  Not impressed. (with Itsu, not yelp.  I still love yelp)

lKczyCgoO9NUlhVqXrLxLQ.text: Really good pit stop for sushi and salad. A bit more pricey than my usual lunch and I could always do with a few extra pieces, but then again I'm greedy when it comes to sushi. Also love the drink pumps.This branch has seating which can be a bit of a bun fight during peak lunch time. There is always a queue but the tills are fast.

_kOaPzwx4i3nduwHwWU7IA.text: Itsu stores are great. I enjoyed their tea bottle drinks, rice crackers, and of course sushi. Can't beat the convenience, speed and price at this quality.

kNQgQUmL0R3kMBsfEnYOCA.text: Good selection of lunch boxes! However, not as good for hot meals :-/

1L54zs03fVnRKl5MgNr5pQ.text: This review covers the Potsu, their miso-based soups.  They were absolutely wonderful and packed with flavor and ingredients. You choose between udon noodles and rice and then a number of other things -- veg, wonton, duck, etc. The soup is very filling and so well packaged it was still steaming after a 10 minute walk back to my hotel. The £5 price is also very welcome in a very expensive Mayfair.  I came back multiple times because they were so good.

AAcx_KoyTnjS-hPZC0Nlvg.text: Bless Itsu. It provides a heavenly distraction from popcorn/food death when going to the Cineworld round the corner, and it's excellent food for invalids (mine live round the other corner). But. It's hoisin duck soup is rubbish. You get barely any hoisin and the duck is the sort of stringy stuff that makes you think dark thoughts of animal camp documentaries. Ditch the duck and pick the excellent (and super cheap) vegetable option instead, then ask for some teriyaki sauce or similar to have over the top of it. The sushi and salads are all delicious and it gets an extra star for being extraordinarily well-priced and a lovely, civilised place to sit in an area where you generally want to shoot yourself after 10 minutes.

kMcO3bLjn8HGlEUHoEfVBg.text: HOLY MOLY WHAT An awesome find!and cheap eats! great for fresh wholesome snacks along the piccadilly-the lemongrass, basil mint lemonade was SO refreshingly yum! only £1.60!-the miso/thai tom yum soup was about £2.95 and was the perfect portion of noodles, veg, and savoury goodness- salads fresh!- i don't to sushi to go, so i can't review that, but it looked fresh as in the prepackaged fish was looking alright if i wanted a quickiei wish we had fresh, quick & wholesome food like this back in north america as a convenient alternative to fast food.gooo UK!

rUBCwqSVH2dDpTQaxvhSvg.text: How can you not love it? Veggie gzouza- my few favorite food in a miso broth. Quick, easy, hot, yummy, filling, cheap. A must have whilst in London.

giHaeRmiBOwvm4FecseY5g.text: Watch out for the Polonium 210-infused sashimi here! Especially if you are a Russian spy.Actually that's not fair. I'm sure the staff here got frightened shitless when they found out the shop was radioactive and I'm sure every cleanliness officer in London has been to check that this place is safe and clean. It's probably cleaner now than Howard Hughes' bedsheets, and in the sushi world that's always a good thing.Itsu does have a very chainy feel about it, even if this little branch tries to retain its small sushi barness. It doesn't quite cut it. The sushi is streets better than Yo!'s terrible efforts but you know you could get much better elsewhere. Good for quickly grabbing a box for lunch but I wouldn't go trying to romance in here, the atmosphere isn't radioactive.

XLmM_5mXGcjKCIBBJzn8zA.text: Hmm...not the best quality sushi but I guess you get what you paid for. I like the concept - ready made sushi to go, but I've had better. It's a good place to grab a quick lunch, but next time I'll try something else besides the sushi/rolls.

kwE7jFlOwa8IEVjVlHW0NQ.text: I don't like sushi but my friend had this the other day and i was very impressed with their fresh selection.

kXGvJcZbIAlIEf9WC5LZLg.text: Delicious sushi from here today. V surprised on the quality from a chain outlet. Will be going here for lunch more often...

Hbcmn2UEuBfVpzxPYlnEhw.text: You will now find Itsu restaurants and takeaways across London.  This upsets me slightly. The first Itsu I ever ate in was on Piccadilly, just opposite Bond Street. At this stage it was a rare find. While I simply love Itsu food, when walking past Itsu Holborn I cannot feel the atmosphere of health, happiness and tranquility that it advertises. Instead it is overcrowded and rather impersonal.I am by no means trying to put you off Itsu, but for the true Itsu experience go to Piccadilly. This may well be my favourite restaurant in London, perfect at any time of day.

photos.caption: Photo of Itsu - London, United Kingdom

sIG4sZklEf80sg6uJiCutQ.text: This is one of the bigger Itsu braches with plenty of comfortable seating space over the two floors, suitable for either large groups or singles. It's always a fine option for lunch in the Piccadilly area as there is enough space even during the busy lunch hours. This branch had also received some notoriety for being the starting point in the polonium affair in 2007. They offer the full largest spectrum of Itsu meals, including the delicious soups, various sushi and sashimi sets and the fresh drinks. All food is prepared from good quality ingredients to a fairly high standard. Of course this isn't a full scale high end restaurant, but by what Itsu aims to offer, it certainly is a leader in the prime Japanese fast food market.

7N8KFOm-1M97CG25L1z3Vw.text: nice healthier version of yo sushi that's great on the go. some nice soups.

SIs4Cfy5J2cgrf_w4GZVRA.text: Itsu is a really unique place to eat some noodles in style. The food is really delicious! You can geta huge portion of spicy dumpling noodle soup which i can never finish so it's good to come with a friend!Sushi boxes range from 4-10 pounds!They do really nice passion fruit mouse shots which are really yummy too! The decor of the palce is really refreshing, lots of white plastic, neon pink, blues and yellows and nice patterns on the walls!

Jx7RTNypekdbDxtcPWE3Vg.text: Best sushi I ever ate. Really nice place, it was all great.

UvAOiTVfE1pFYIjBklwb6Q.text: Not as good as Wasabi, but still. Good food at a price.

JOsCMNK5PAeS9jghWzGluQ.text: Yes! I love this chain and this location in particular.They have MASTERED the art of the business lunch. The shelves are always fully stocked, the meals are always very fresh, the lineups move quickly - you can't ask for more when you're running down the street to grab lunch in between meetings.FOOD:- Grab the Salmon sushi trio - my absolute favorite (sushi, sashimi and rolls all with salmon).- If it's cold outside or you have a cold yourself, then grab the detox bowl. So much broth and vegetables, you might not even finish it!- Get the frozen yogurt anytime of year. YUM!- Oh and the chocolate rice cakes are a favorite mid-afternoon snack.I miss Itsu and can't wait to be back in London and head there daily!

GqOYnBVqJfDqqUgvZiPXyg.text: I really love the detox soup. It's vegan, it's tasty, it's low in calories, and it's super cheap. What's not to love? Itsu is a go-to for me when I need a quick lunch in London.

Iq67WhDQ5YJbrjhbDv8voQ.text: Fast food sushi. Who knew? This place is decent and a nice stop for a quick fix of boxed salmon and tuna sushi. There is ample seating downstairs for small groups and the service is fast. Be warned that a bottle of Asahi is 8.5 pounds.  I only give it 3 stars because the attendant could not understand English too well and didn't think about opening our beer bottles upon purchase. Service needs work!

td8jQXXkfD9dS8ku2Rfqzw.text: I came here for a quick takeaway lunch. It was packed around noon, but I was able to pick up a quick veggie sushi plate and be on my way. I ended up getting a plate of 12 pieces of sushi, side salad and 4 gyoza. All in all I think I paid about 6 pounds. Great quick, fresh and delicious sushi for lunch!Note: I only gave Itsu 4 stars instead of 5 stars because there was no wasabi or ginger included in my plate. Soy sauce was included, but I would have liked to see some wasabi and ginger.

photos.caption: Photo of Itsu - London, United Kingdom. Veggie combo minus a few pieces cause I ate them!

ot5Z2LyuyaWM_nqBqoLjFQ.text: Honestly I've probably sampled everything on their menu... Shameful? Is there any to be had in that? Well if there is I ain't got any baby!!Their salmon with rice and teriyaki sauce is soooooo good..you even get to feel healthy about it all as the rice is overflowing with edamame beans! YAY (NOT!!!!) ... The chicken version is amazing too however the pickled ginger on top has to go! Eviction style! The sushi is really good too! Overall it's a nice drop spot for a quick nibble .. Not a fan of their juices and the mangoes in the fruit pots are very much on the unripe side.. They should hire a mangoe inspector to look into that. I'd do it if the price was right

photos.caption: Photo of Itsu - London, United Kingdom

VJEqmFRm4pncpvHk4ngw4Q.text: This was my first time trying out this chain. It's a nice clean place with a modern atmosphere feel and take on Asian food. I got the chicken udon noodles and my fiancé got the Thai chicken rice bowl. I like that the food already comes in To go containers. The food was good. Would go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Itsu - London, United Kingdom. Charred chicken udon and thai chicken rice bowl.

hOM97I2mDyiyI1rE6OY5Sg.text: Ahhhhh. *rubs forehead whilst eating a banana*This place is really a means to an end. I pretty much tried everything in the shop before i realised it all tastes the same. Bland, supposedly healthy, unexciting. And the list can go on. the same sauce can not go with 67 other dishes, in what world did the chefs think this worked?!Dont go here hoping to board the train to flavour town. it DOES NOT depart from here sadly.

DnFjHXK7b2mqXPsj09yfQw.text: I like this place.  It's tasty, and healthy, and affordable.  SWEET TRIFECTA, BRO.Their marketing claims that Itsu is the Asian-influenced brainchild of some of the founders of Pret.  In that regard, I can see some similarities: stocked shelves, efficient pay system, done.  The hot stuff looks good, but I head for the coolers, always.  My go-to are the low carb salads: rare-cooked salmon on a bed of greens (n.b.: if you hate cilantro, there's some in the dressing) and a delicious tuna salad that has thin-sliced leeks included.  There's a chicken/avocado salad, too, for the low carb-ers among us, but that just doesn't seem to trade on the strengths of Itsu.I'm also a fan of their sushi, edamame and protein pots.  Always fresh, and really affordable.  It...su delicious!  Yelp note: I especially like how I have the option to "PIMP MY FOODS" care of toasted sesame and sauces (hey, chill!) and pumpkin / sunflower seeds at the condiment bar.  Sometimes I like it saucy, sometimes I don't, you know?  (I usually do, for the record)

FK6MlBhKu3aGGGpKZwgrGw.text: Quick, easy and fast place to get food. Love their options and quick grab meals. The Chicken rice was yummy & filling and the Thai curry was really big and our favorite choice! You get half off quick grab items at 9:30 pm

1Y0KrY8n14bxkOOS3GRnDg.text: Its so light and healthy. The food is super fresh. Amazing service. And the place is super clean.

_ISxuoAJ1BfeeygTv1b77A.text: Might as well get grocery store sushi. Everyone saying this is "so fresh" has probably never really had fresh sushi. To add insult to injury the avocado was hard as a rock.

oFGrUY1VOTYDBXEzydKYrg.text: I walked in a bit skeptical. It seems a bit conventional fast food-ish. But I had to say, I was quite impressed with the taste. And with all the delicious sauce and meat they packed in.... plus they are kinda fast food-ish, Itsu is a healthy choice for people on the go. I got the dish with duck meat, and it was delicious.I also bought their packed salmon sashimi bento, and the salmon tasted really fresh. I now wish there were more Itsu's around.... and please open some in the Netherlands. I'm definitely a fan.

-4_nfcrdlDullUh5yIaPYw.text: I like this place when before closing they sell half price sushi!! so i can take a lot of them and bring at home!

PzbXq_zfbqmCkGPM2_IXHQ.text: Not a lot to say about Itsu as a chain, but definitely something to be said about the service here. The employees at the Piccadilly branch are just really friendly, kind, and professional.  Worth writing a review to point out!

XyFqZ0y8nQ51dm9IxYQ5nQ.text: On a recent shopping excursion to Piccadilly on a rainy Saturday, we wanted a quick, inexpensive lunch and as Pret a Manger was packed with people not wanting to head back into the rain, we popped into Itsu. Itsu was a Japanese version of Pret but with a lot more tables, quirky Japanese whimsy and very healthy food options. My husband enjoyed a steaming bowl of tofu, brown rice and steamed green vegetables while I had extremely fresh salmon sashimi and a couple of avocado sushi rolls. Just for fun, we tried their Thai sweet chili popcorn and chocolate popcorn. Both were delicious and very low calorie! Definitely wish we had Itsu in the USA!

PfbXOLu8-GgHSmgn67fGXw.text: Stopped in here for lunch at the start of February. The service was a bit ropey but the pricing was pretty keen and the quality of the sushi (particularly the tuna sashimi) was very good. Would definitely revisit.

-YbG0GKR2_7HVZim499ttw.text: Came here for a quick dinner, and was impressed by the variety of fresh sushi available, and the soup bowls.I found the sushi to be really tasty. I had been suggested the frozen yoghurt and the chocolate mousse, so I'll have to try the next time.At this location the staff is friendly, and there is plenty of comfortable seating. Definitely an option for a quick meal, or if you want to take a load off for a bit and grab a bite to eat.

_jWQ4CLqEeztLYLopewQCg.text: I was ok with itsu (by ok I mean it's eatable when I'm hungry) UNTIL I had their sushi. Maybe it's just me but I hate the taste of their sushi... It just doesn't taste right........I love sushi (eat them a lot!!) but ewww not the itsu ones. Yea yea i don't expect it to be as good as the ones in Japanese restaurants but still with a similar price wasabi sushis are wayyyy better....

-Cns-HwbuGfSJP3lb3FtJw.text: Great, affordable, healthy Japanese-inspired option in a hella expensive city. Trendy atmosphere is the cherry on top.

joY26_HKNHmCECkQtKQehQ.text: This review is specifically about Itsu's frozen yogurt. My wife and I jumped on the froyo craze many many years ago and we have tried practically every brand in the US. We were dying looking around London for a frozen yogurt place when we stumbled into this fastfood sushi place. A bit about our tastes, we are purists when it comes to froyo and we specifically love the plain tart froyo. No matter where we go that's the flavor we will get and the bar with which we grade how much we love the froyo. The froyo at Itsu is much thicker and tangy compared to what we have tried in the past. It is much closer to the Greek yogurt taste that you might have tried in the past. (Actually, we have thought of plans of trying to recreate froyo at home using Greek yogurt) If you're a fan of plain tart froyo you should make a trip to Itsu to give their froyo a try!
